DataElement.preferredName: Genetic Modification Chimeric Antigen Receptor Construct Use Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe the construct used in the genetic modification to create the chimeric antigen receptor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Genetic Modification Chimeric Antigen Receptor Construct Use
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Techniques used for deliberately altering the genetic material of an organism in order to make them capable of making new substances or performing new or different functions._A cell-surface receptor that has been engineered to combine novel features and specificities from various sources in order to enhance its antigen specificity. Engineered T-cells or B-cells will produce the specialized receptor that will be capable of binding to an epitope on its target cell._An abstract or general idea inferred or derived from specific instances._A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.

Concepts.definition: Techniques used for deliberately altering the genetic material of an organism in order to make them capable of making new substances or performing new or different functions.

A cell-surface receptor that has been engineered to combine novel features and specificities from various sources in order to enhance its antigen specificity. Engineered T-cells or B-cells will produce the specialized receptor that will be capable of binding to an epitope on its target cell.
An abstract or general idea inferred or derived from specific instances.
